comments:
When I try to use the file server through the CCTL I can see some exception from the FileManagerFactory:

Exception in thread "org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.task.ReusableThread@2f1921" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.util.AgentControllerDescriptor.versionIsAtLeast(AgentControllerDescriptor.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.util.AgentControllerDescriptor.isVersionAtLeast(AgentControllerDescriptor.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerFactory$3.run(FileManagerFactory.java:413)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.task.ReusableThread.run(ReusableThread.java:131)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

This is because the new AC cannot return the appropriate version of the property:

name = "org.eclipse.hyades.execution"
type = "version"

The RAC can return the correct version (e.g. 4.1.0) while the new AC just return an empty property list.

This is blocking the file server function.

I have tried adding the following to the config file (under "AgentControllerConfiguration" and CCTL's "Configuration")

<Option name="org.eclipse.hyades.execution" type="version" value="4.2.0"/>

and it still doesn't work.

Created an attachment (id=35997)
File Server test case
I've run the attached test case with the TPTP-4.2.0-200603081542 build of the new Agent Controller (using M5a Eclipse and M5 TPTP and dependencies) and it works with no problems.
This works for me with TPTP-4.2.0-200603081542.
Verified with my test case using TPTP-4.2.0-200603140100 driver.
